#Text=Video of man tasered at Vancouver airport released
#Text=Thursday , November 15 , 2007
#Text=A video showing a man being tasered by police and subsequently dying at the Vancouver International Airport has been released to the media .
#Text=The cause of his death has not yet been determined .
#Text=Robert Dziekanski , 40 , was immigrating from Pieszyce , Poland to live with his mother , Zofia Cisowski , in Kamloops , British Columbia .
#Text=He did not clear customs at the airport for over eight hours and his mother was unable to locate him when she went to meet him at the airport .
#Text=Since Dziekanski did not speak English airport security guards were unable to properly communicate with him .
#Text=He started yelling at the airport staff because of this .
#Text=He used chairs to prop open a door between a customs clearing area and a public lounge , he then threw a computer and threw a small table at a luggage section window .
#Text=He had calmed down and was standing with his hands at his side in the customs room until four Royal Canadian Mounted Police ( RCMP ) officers arrived and tasered the man , at least twice .
#Text=Dziekanski began to convulse and was tasered a second time after falling to the ground , where the four officers pinned him down and handcuffed him .
#Text=He screamed before he stopped moving .
#Text=Paramedics arrived at the scene , but were unable to revive him and pronounced him dead .
#Text=Dziekanski 's mother had told him to wait in the luggage area where she would meet him , not realizing that this was inside the airport 's security zone , which was inaccessible to her .
#Text=Arriving international passengers need to pass through customs first , before being able to meet people waiting to pick them up .
#Text=His mother had tried in vain to get a message to him and eventually left the airport when told by airport staff that he was n't there .
#Text=Paul Pritchard , who had just arrived from China back to Victoria , shot a video of the incident and gave it to police .
#Text=The police promised they would return the video within 48 hours .
#Text=They gave him back his camera without the video .
#Text=Pritchard immediately hired a lawyer , held his own news conference , and threatened that he would take them to court to get it back .
#Text=CBC , CTV and Global television paid Pritchard several thousand dollars for the video , and he says he will use the money to take care of his father .
#Text="

#Text=I would also like to express my concerns for those people who were in any way touched by this extraordinary and tragic occurrence - our employees working that night , the various agencies involved , the emergency responders and the passengers who may have come across the scene ,  Larry Berg , President and CEO of the Vancouver Airport Authority said on November 1 .

#Text=Polish ambassador to Canada , Piotr Ogrodzinski , said  Mr. Dziekanski ( was ) a person who was agitated , frustrated , I think terrified , but not aggressive .

column1: #Text=In fact , he was in search ( of ) help .
#Text=That is why it is a really very sad and deeply moving film to watch .
#Text="
